comment: She is a nice person but I would stay away from this class. She treats her students like children, grades extremely tough, and the work load is a lot.

Her class was fun and interesting, but the assignments were not fun unless you like to write. She is also way too punctual and won't cut anyone slack. She is also much too harsh on grading. She won't bump you by a point even though it's one of those 69, 79, 89, etc. grades. You should read for class.

I hate English but I've enjoyed her class. She is really clear about what she wants, the reading are interesting. Peer workshop really helps with your papers. She is really nice and funny. She is a fair grader, you get the grade you deserve. You have to work hard in her class but she helps you along the way and it is really worth it.

This prof knows what she is doing and she does it with style. I agree with the person before who said she is inspiring. That is the perfect word for her, as a teacher she is wonderful. I would take the class all over again if I could (got an A, by the way!).

I highly recommend Ms. Marshall. She is a very tough grader but you will actually learn something. I have never been more inspired by another teachers love and dedication to actually work as hard as i could myself. Even steered me into writing as a career. Super helpful, available anytime. Overall best teacher for sure.

Ms. Marshall is a fantastic teacher. She makes class really fun and she is always open to discussion and help outside of class. She always looks professional and while she is a tough grader, she is very fair and gives as much help as she can.

I completely recommend Ms. Marshall! I agree you can tell she's a new teacher but that is what makes her great, she is really into it and she really cares. She met with me whenever I had questions, she was always there. Great teacher, in my humble opinion.

She loves her job, and I can tell that she does, but I can see that she's clearly a new teacher. She treats students like children and gets on to them for remedial things. She's a harsh grader, but I do admit that she's willing to help you with anything you need. I'd let her teach longer, then take her class. Avoid her for now.
